title: Mini Berry and Cream Tarts
description: Beautiful, elegant and melting-in-your-mouth delicious tarts.
story: Lately I was making a lot of these for a holiday season. In different variation: as a tart - for a dinner, as mini tarts for party, just as a casual cake. </br></br>Really easy to make, pastry can be made in advance and frozen. </br></br>The pastry is a real deal here, if you want to avoid cream - just put some peaches or plums on the crust - and I believe it'll be as good.
instructions: Preheat our oven to 350 F degrees.
Beat egg with 60 g of sugar.
In a food processor add 150 g of flour, baking powder and salt, mix. Add cold diced butter, process well.
To the flour and butter start adding egg mixture and almond meal, process well.
Form a ball out of the pastry and keep refrigerated for 30 min.
Meanwhile make cream. Whisk cream cheese, with sugar and egg, add a table spoon of flour and an almond extract.
Whisk cream till it becomes smooth.
Roll the pastry into 5mm thick round. Cut out 12 small (8cm) rounds out of it using a cup or a glass.
Place small pastry rounds into the non-sticking cupcake tin.
Add about 1.5 tablespoon of cream on each of the tarts.
Take out of the oven and put on the wired rack to completely cool.
Decorate with berries and powdered sugar.
